column5: any fishermen ever fished stokes rainy lake camp on canadian side of rainy lake very remote talked to owner 4 cabins with main lodge on island:boat in from us side anyone fished the camp recently your experiences are appreciated fish 65% walleye 35% northerns and enjoy smallmouth fishing price seems good but want to make sure fishing was decent not a bad ride from chicago probably go last week of may or 2nd or 3rd week of september thanks jim wolf chicago boys
I would be happy to chat with you. Can't send you a PM unless you log in.

Camp Chef, would you mind posting about your experience at Stokes? I ran across this one while researching last year. We ended up going to Camp Narrows, but I sure liked how Stokes sounded remote. From what I could tell by their website, the cabins looked a bit rustic, so figured they wouldn't be up to my wife's standards.

The camp is quite rustic,which is one of the reasons we love it. The outhouse,though not close is very clean. They do have a shower shed that can be used once the water is pumped in and heated.Dan said they have some women that come year after year,but I think most of the guests are guys looking for a rustic experience. Feel free to pm me if you have any other questions.
Is there any power to recharge batteries?
